org.javautil.hibernate.persist
Class TransactionHelper

java.lang.Object
  org.javautil.hibernate.persist.TransactionHelper
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
public class TransactionHelper
extends Object
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

An InitializingBean to simplify programmatic transaction management. Not intended to be used in a declarative transaction managed environment. Manipulates hibernate Session and Transaction objects so that application code does not need to directly reference them.

Author:
bcm

Method Detail

afterPropertiesSet

public void afterPropertiesSet()
Required for InitializingBean interface. Ensures that a hibernate session is set or the current session from a SessionFactory is set.

Specified by:
afterPropertiesSet in interface org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

isTransactionActive

public boolean isTransactionActive()
Returns true when a transaction has been started and is active, that is, not committed or rolled back.

Returns:
if transaction is active

startTransaction

public org.hibernate.Transaction startTransaction()
Starts a transaction or gets the current transaction if one is already started. Any existing inactive transaction will be dereferenced. If an active transaction already exists, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

Returns:
the current transaction or a new one
Throws:
IllegalStateException

getTransaction

public org.hibernate.Transaction getTransaction()
Gets a current, already started, active transaction. If one does not already exist, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. Useful when it is inappropriate to start a new transaction, and an existing transaction is expected to exist.

Returns:
Throws:
IllegalStateException

rollback

public void rollback()
Performs a rollback if an active transaction exists.If an active transaction does not exist, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

Throws:
IllegalStateException

commit

public void commit()
Performs a commit if an active transaction exists. If an active transaction does not exist, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

Throws:
IllegalStateException

commitAndStartTransaction

public void commitAndStartTransaction()
Same as commit and then startTransaction

flush

public void flush()
Move the session level ob jects to the persistence engine. If the persistence engine is a relational database then the insert, update, delete operations should be performed.
